summary: Annually, about $500 million in grants are awarded at EPA's discretion to state governments, nonprofits, tribes, and others. The grants pay for activities such as environmental research and wetlands restoration. We found that EPA has developed policy on how to advertise grants, evaluate applications, and award the grants. A senior official oversees the process. However, EPA still has work to do to make information about...
title: Grants Management: EPA Has Taken Steps to Improve Competition for Discretionary Grants but Could Make Information More Readily Available
